dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: 96 degrees and climbing on the Central Park Parade Grounds -- the ol' Greenhouse Effect is humming today! Your Environmental Advisory Council sets the Discomfort Index at +9, the Risk Factor at 8.3, the highest it's been since August of 1978.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: The National Guard reports that skirmish in Brooklyn Heights has been pacified, and traffic on the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges is moving once again. If you are among those unlucky enough to be caught in that particular mess, please remain patient, and have your passes ready for inspection by the time you reach the gate. Now back to Ronny Lasar and more Golden Hits of the Seventies.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Sometimes a bright light's shining on me Other times I can barely see Lately it's occurred to me What a long strange trip it's been.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: God, will you please turn that cornball stuff off? I can't stand Seventies music END OF TITLES. FADE TO BLACK. SOUND OF INTERSPACIAL WIND. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CRAWL
dialogues.text: In 1973, following the release of Last House on the Left, the writer/director of that film was committed for psychiatric observation. He was treated extensively with drugs group therapies, electroshock programs and a final lobotomy. Despite these efforts at reform, Craven killed his nurse, Maura Heaphy, and escaped to the Mohave Desert. At the end of 1000 days of meditation he was taken up by a jet- black saucer and trained in Secondary Media Infiltration and parametaphysical survival on the Planet Jupiter. Upon his graduation he was returned to the planet Earth at Exeter. This Film is his first since his return, and is respectfully dedicated to the memory of Maura Heaphy.

dialogues.speaker: PAIN.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse, feral) Pa pa? Pa pa?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Pa pa huntin'. What you wan'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma Ma, summin's cumin.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Army? P.O.V. No. Ain't cops, neither. It'sa car ana camper. I see it now.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Pluto. P.O.V. Yuh.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: We're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: We're lost.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Now we are not! We're right here, someplace, on this little blue road.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Ma, this road is definitely not a blue line. It's a dotted line if it's anything at all -- let me see that!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (to her mother) What's the last town we passed? That one yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Um, well, I think it was Corn Creek. Or that's what we were supposed to --

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (horrified) "Nellis Air Force Range and Nuclear Testing Site. Closed to the Public." Good grief, Daddy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Alright, everybody settle down! THE CAR FALLS SILENT. EVEN THE BABY IS STARTLED.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We are not on a bomb range, we are not goddamn lost, we are not --

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Daddy, for god's sakes slow down, you'll loose the trailer -- Doug and Bobby --

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Bob! Watch!

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN FRONT OF THEM.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You and your stupid shortcuts, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (to the desert) Twenty-five years I'm a cop in the worst goddamn precinct in New York City. The niggers shot arrows at me, the Puerto Ricans tried to kill me by throwing dogs at me from the fucking roofs! I was even shot at on three separate occasions by my own men by mistake, of course, but none of those bastards ever came as close to killing me as my own goddamn wife with her goddamn road maps and wrong turns and goddamn hysterical screaming and --

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (reserved) You've soiled your pants.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (arrested) I've what? (He stares at the stain on his trousers) That's coffee. I spilled my goddamn coffee -- Jesus, Ethel.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Watch your language.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (straightening) I'm sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Unlock it, stupid!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Now I know how Fearless Fosdick feels when he gets put in an ash can and kicked down the cellar stairs. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (hugging Doug) I don't know. There was a couple of planes, and then some poor animal in the road -- You okay, boy?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Nothing broken. How 'bout you -- and Shanti?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: We're both fine. She was crying before we went off the road, but now she seems quiet. BOBBY SLIDES UP TO BRENDA.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Brenda, aren't you going to ask if your darling brother is alright? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Na. Get out of here, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You see? She does care.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (reassuringly) It's catsup, folks. Got it on me, too. The kitchen's all over the place in there.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Turkey buzzard. Janitor of the desert

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Does that mean there's a town nearby? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (smiling) You mean like when stranded sailors see sea birds and know they're nearing land?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: (radio) Pluto?

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: (P.0.V. Voice) They off t'road. Stuck.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (calling 0.S.) Beauty! C'mere, girl! BEAUTY LEAVES FOR THE FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Maybe you should tie Beauty up, Bobby. We don't want her running off after a rabbit and disappearing, like she did in Montana.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That was the Beast that did that, not Beauty, and it was a bitch in South Dakota, not a rabbit in Montana. Beauty always comes when I call her.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What's the verdict? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I don't wanna say it, but I think the axle's snapped.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Can't you fix it?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What'1ll we do?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Punt.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Don't shoot 'till you see the whites of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Don't try to make me feel silly. Who knows what kind of animals live out here?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I do. I did a paper on desert ecology. Biggest thing out here is the coyote. He's too smart to bother with us.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: What about snakes and bugs.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (granting her a point) They won't bother us if we don't bother them. ETHEL NODS, FEELING JUSTIFIED IN HER WORRIES, NOW. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: If it's all the same to you, I'll put my faith in the Lord and that gun, rather than coyotes and rattlesnakes.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Well, at least Shanti's taking all this calmly. They decide to go for help? (she nods toward the family.)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: You'll blow up if you don't breathe, you know.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lynne?!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (a bit too casually) Your Dad and I are going to take a walk see if we can find some help.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (to Doug) Aren't you taking a gun, Doug? Bob'1ll give you one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mom, but I've got my five fingers of death, here. (he mimes a comic strike)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (shrugging, adjusting his own shoulder holster) Doug'll go that way, me back the way we came.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (checking his watch) It's 3:30. We've five hours of daylight left.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Well, how far can you go in two hours?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Seven miles, maybe; it'll give us a chance to find something.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What do you expect to find out here? We're in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, we passed some sort of station about five miles back...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) You're in charge here, now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: That's sexism. He's not in charge of me.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: I'm in charge. Alright, get going, then! THE MEN LAUGH AT THE WOMAN'S MIME OF MILITARY AUTHORITY.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Synchronize watches! It's 3:38. If you're not back by 8:30 we'll send the dogs out after you! Good hunting, men! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Can we just have a word of prayer? EVERYONE FALLS SERIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Oh, Mother, for crying out loud...

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Just to ask the Lord to watch over us all. Is that too much to ask? Bob? BOB NODS. EVERYONE STEPS A LITTLE CLOSER TOGETHER.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Beauty, shut up, already!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beauty!

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Bring some plates, would you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ARE TOGETHER FOR THE FIRST TIME BY THEMSELVES.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: This is a fine way to spend the eve of your twenty-fifth wedding anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Well, it's kind of a pretty place. And there's certainly a lot of sunshine. I don't think I've seen so much sunshine since I was a girl.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Your system just doesn't know what to do with clean air and room to stretch.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (off on her own thoughts) I suppose it's my fault we got lost...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous, Ma -- it was Daddy's stupid idea to try sneaking in the back way. We had enough to bribe the border guards.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: We could've been in California by now if we'd staying on route 93. Showers... Fresh fruit... BEAUTY CONTINUES TO BARK FROM INSIDE THE TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: What do you suppose is bugging her?

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Rattlesnakes, I'll bet. BOBBY RETURNS WITH PAPER PLATES AND PLASTIC SILVERWARE.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You guys kill me.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I wonder why the Beast isn't chiming in? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (helping self to food) He knows better. He never barks, anyway, he just goes for the kill whenever he gets the chance.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: He sure does!

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Remember that poodle he almost killed in Miami. Oh, boy, was that lady fit to be tied!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Was Daddy ever mad! He had to pay the vet bills! THEY ALL LAUGH AT THE REMEMBRANCE. THERE'S A SHIFT.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: So, Lynne, when are you and Doug going to make it official? THERE'S AN AWKWARD SILENCE. LYNNE LIGHTS A CIGARETTE.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Maybe when we reach our twenty-fifth anniversary, like Mama and Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: I won't comment...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (anticipating) "But..." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: But it seems to me awfully backward the way you two are doing things. I mean that sweet little baby of yours...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: A bastard?

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: That's not what I was going to say. My granddaughter is... no bastard.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Can a girl be a bastard, anyway? (to Bobby) What's the female of Bastard?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Bassinet.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beauty! Get back here!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Bobby !? SHE CATCHES UP WITH HIM AND TRIES TO HAND HIM THE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Humor me. THE TWO EXCHANGE GLANCES. BOBBY SHAKES HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're the one that's so scared. You keep it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Beauty! C'mon back, girl!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beauty! Beauty! HE STRUGGLES UPWARD AGAIN, TRYING TO GO FASTER.

dialogues.speaker: . VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, pig.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Bobby! Come down, now!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beauty? THERE'S NO SIGN FROM UP THERE. BOBBY STARTS CLIMBING UP, HIS FACE SET.

dialogues.speaker: BRANCHES.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Beauty?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Jesus, it must have dropped twenty degrees in the last hour.

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR THE MOTHER SPEAKING SOME SORT OF GIBBERISH.
ETHEL
dialogues.text: Calling Smokey the Bear, calling Smokey the Bear, this is Moby Grape... hello?

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (improvising) Maypole, maypole, this is Moby Grape calling. Hello there, um...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: It's "Mayday," Mom, not "Maypole."

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Oh. ETHEL SHRUGS IN EXASPERATION.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Darn thing won't ever work for me. Guess I don't have the touch.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Let me have a try. THE MOTHER SCOOTS OVER AND LYNNE TAKES THE MICROPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Mayday, Mayday, this is Mobile Unit 2345CB. We are stranded and in need of assistance. Does anybody read us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (quietly) What the hell was that? ETHEL SITS BACK, STILL STARING AT THE RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: It sounded like some sort of animal...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: If the animals out here are smart enough to run a goddamn radio, we're in serious trouble.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Watch your language.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Where's Bobby and the men, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Brenda?  26 23.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (calling) Bobbeeee!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Beast! Get back here! THE DOG IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (calling from back by the trailer) Brenda? You there? BRENDA LOOKS BACK TOWARDS THE TRAILER FOR A MOMENT.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (calling) In a minute, Lynne.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Bobby? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (hushed) Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (very quietly) Dad and Doug back?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (still looking down the road) Not yet. (she turns to her brother) You didn't find Beauty? BOBBY TURNS AND WALKS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She must have run off.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN, BOBBY IS GIVEN A COAT.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: You want cheese on your hamburger?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't want anything. ETHEL STUDIES HER SON.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: You sick or something.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little. Nothing serious. Did anyone try the C/B?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: We tried. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Once it sounded like the thing was an obscene phone caller.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Well, it sort of huffed and puffed, like, wouldn't you say so, Lynne?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: It was static. BOBBY LOOKS AT THE TWO WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: HE PICKS UP THE PISTOL AND OPENS THE DOOR.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: He's such a Macho.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey, don't shoot. I surrender

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Did I miss dinner?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You and Brenda have another fight? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad's not back yet... and where were you?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It's a lot slower going out there than we thought. Big Bob's surely on his way back. And he'll see the fire... If nothing else, we'll just send the Beast out after him. The Beast always gets his man.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The Beast broke free and took off half an hour ago. Beauty's dead.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Beauty's what?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She chased off right after you and Dad left. She was after something. She caught up with whatever it was on top of that bluff. By the time I got up there she was dead.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (sobered) Must've been a cougar, something big like that.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She was gutted. DOUG STUFFS TOBACCO INTO THE BOWL OF HIS PIPE.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: A cougar might do that. Nothing else around capable of taking on a German Shepherd, anyway. Beauty was no pussycat.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You tell the others?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Just as well.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: I knew when you smelled food you'd show up!

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Find anything? SHE KISSES HIM, GIVING BRENDA A PLAYFUL SHOVE AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: There's a sort of blockhouse, abandoned, about five miles out. Nothing in it. Looks like it used to be used by the Military.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You go any further?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: There isn't any further. The road ends there. (avoiding further discussion) I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: MAPS OF THE STRUGGLE, GETTING MADDER AND MADDER.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHE STUDIES THE GIRL.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Warm nuff, Ruby? THE GIRLS NODS DEFERENTIALLY.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Y'like yer dog?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Yuh, Ma Ma.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Ain't every day we get dog. Makes coyote taste like shit.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Dog's ghost is talking out there tonight... MA MA LOOKS MORE CLOSELY AT THE GIRL, SMELLING THE FEAR. EYES NARROW.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: You just got the curse, is all. Makes you haywire. By tomorrow morning you be clean again, can come back in with us. Ain't no such thing as dog ghost!

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Big sonuvabitch. Ain't no fuckin' ghost neither.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Nother dog?

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: (nodding) Nother dog. Big ol' stud.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Good he's round here. Means he ain't round there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: "Round where?

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Don't look that too secure, old boy, we're going out in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Where you guys going?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Just out to the station wagon. HE WINKS AT BOBBY. BOBBY SEES NO HUMOUR IN THIS.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Geez, Doug -- I mean, Dad's out there lost or hurt, and you guys are acting like you could care less -- you --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Number one, there's no way anything short of a platoon of Huns is going to get to Big Bob. He's tough as hell and armed. Two -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How about a snake or a fall -- this isn't the South Bronx -- he might not know where to look for danger here.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Two, if he's not back in an hour, I personally will schlep out and find him -- remember, we have one dim flashlight, one pistol, and only two men to guard three women and an infant.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Guard them from what?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was just a cougar.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: All set?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: All set. (to Bobby) Why don't you get some sleep?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why don't you take this along, just for insurance.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Happiness is a warm gun. Relax. See you in a while, if you're still awake.

dialogues.speaker: FROM IT AND TURNS ON A RADIO AT THE BACK OF THE TABLE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Several hundred demonstrators still remain at the border, and police confirm now that there were fatalities among... static... busses burned, most of them from Northeastern cities. Meanwhile the Supreme Court still has not handed... static... on the Constitutionality of states in the Sunbelt imposing limitations on immigrants from the megalopolitan zone. (pause) We'll have more about that meltdown in Chicago, and weatherman Abby Hoffman reveals all about the Seattle quake and why it won't come here, after this word from the folks at Remington Firearms.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I'll protect you, I'll protect you I'll hold you, I'll warm you I'll protect you, I'll need you... (suddenly wary) Don't touch me. CLOSE ON LYNNE'S FACE, WHICH LOOMS UP. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Don't touch him, don't touch me. CLOSE ON THE INFANT SHANTI.

dialogues.speaker: SHANTI
dialogues.text: Touch me.

dialogues.speaker: FAR WINDOW.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Jesus, there's not enough room to swing a cat back here -- I can -- oooh. Ooohmm -- got it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: If you don't turn that crap down I'll kill you with my bare hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You and whose army?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You want me to wake Mommie?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (mimicking) "want me to wake mom-meee?"

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: No sign of Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You mean like a tingling at the back of my neck, or something.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: There's no need to get snotty. I'm worried; I keep having scary dreams.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If he's not back in a few minutes I'll go out with a flashlight and meet him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, you can't come.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This is man's work.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You're a disgusting human being, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (dreamily) What's up, champ?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Thought I heard the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: He ran off before, now he's back...

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (guessing his next words) And it sounds like he's trying to tell us something?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (grinning) Something like that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: You've been watching too much Lassie. He'll show up in the morning for breakfast with a nose full of porcupine quills, or smelling like a skunk. C'mere. SHE PULLS HIM DOWN NEXT TO HER.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I promised Bobby I'd go out and look for Big Bob.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Just stay with me a little. You know how I hate jumping up as soon as we've finished.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beast?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY FEELS THE FEAR MOUNTING.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beast, c'mere, boy. C'mere!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beast, here boy! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Beast? SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, boy!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You've got to get the flashlight, can't see a damn...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (to himself) You asshole! You locked yourself out! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: IT AGAIN. THE CAR STARTS TO SHAKE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (unbelieving) Je-sus!

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (crossly) Alright.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: This better be good.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I need to borrow your keys.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL HIS ANGER AND AWKWARDNESS.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I locked myself out.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: You couldn't wait? BOBBY BLOWS UP IN RAGE.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Gimme your keys, for god'sakes! You expect me to wait all night -- The Beast is out there hurt or something, Dad's not back and you two can't find anything better --

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: All right, Bobby, just get off the podium.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Alright, both of you; it's time we got organized, here. (to Bobby) Now, what's this about the Beast being hurt? We just heard him a while back and he sounded chipper as hell.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: But didn't you hear him screaming? I've got to get the flashlight! DOUG PRODUCES THE KEYS AND THE TWO HEAD FOR THE TRAILER. LYNNE, MEANWHILE, IS SCRAMBLING INTO HER CLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ethellll!!!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ethel -- mother help meee!!!

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Bob

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Ethel, don't go out there! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Brenda? Keep an eye on Shanti, okay?

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (soundlessly) Daddy... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Good God, I'm sorry Bob, it's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: THROWN FIFTEEN FEET INTO THE KITCHENETTE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Ba-bee fat. You all fat. 'juu - ceee!

dialogues.speaker: TONGUE POKES OUT AS IF TO MOISTEN LIPS THAT NOW ARE ASH.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Gheillgh.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Wagh-ergh... Wagh... Rrr. DOUG PULLS ETHEL UP, SHAKING HER GENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Ethel, we'll need water. He wants water Would you get some?

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: That's not Bob, that's not my Bob, is it?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Of course not, Mom, it's someone else. He needs water... please.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: I'll go with you, Ma. THE TwO WOMEN GET TO THEIR FEET, WEAVING IN THE SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Whiskey and blankets, too, Lynne.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You all right, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Give me your coat, would you? He's still cold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Your coat.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: So long, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That's not the answer.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're not my father.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Neither is that. My father's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: Women's cuming!

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Send em in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: Shanti! LYNNE RUSHES INTO THE TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Get out the way.

dialogues.speaker: LYNNE
dialogues.text: (livid with rage.) Where the fucking hell you think you're going with my kid?

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR TOWARDS THE FORGOTTEN KNIFE. NOW SHE HAS IT.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Get out of here, you nigger!

dialogues.speaker: UNCEREMONIOUSLY DUMPS THE GIRL AND RUNS.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Shh, don't try to talk, honey, everything's okay now --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Stay with her. DOUG RUNS INTO THE TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (roaring) You bastards! HE RACES OUT INTO THE NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: See to your mother!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Shannn-tiiiiiii! !!

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN THEM. THE INFANT IS WATLING.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (distant 0.S.) Shannn-tiiiiii!!!

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Daddy? Where's my Daddy? Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (curtly) Brenda, get me some clean towels, then see if you can find the first aid kit. Brenda!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (distant 0.S.) Shannn-tiiiiii!!!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper ) Shanti!

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: (quietly) Pluto 'n Mars, 'proachin' home twenty. Don't pop us. SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: You got yer ears on, Mer'cry?

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY, (VIA C/B)
dialogues.text: Roger, Pluto. What's your 10-20?

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: We at the ballpark on Big Mac. And we got the goods, plus a bonus bacon, straight from the Dirty Side.

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY, (VIA C/B)
dialogues.text: Haw! Ma Ma gonna be happy with that! C'mon through. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: 10-4 on that, Merc'ry.

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Ten-four, Pluto.

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: What? PLUTO LISTENS MORE CAREFULLY. SHAKES HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: Thought I heard somethin'. Rocks fallin'.

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Y'got rocks in yer head, asshole. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO, (C/B)
dialogues.text: Hello, home 20, you reading me?

dialogues.speaker: MARS, (C/B)
dialogues.text: (singing loudly) Oh, don't tell the priest our plight Or he would call it sin But we've been out in the woods all night conjurin' summer in!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Pluto? You okay?

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO, (C/B)
dialogues.text: Damn right! N' got a present for ya... (static) Baby... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PLUTO (cont 'd) (static) So heat up the pot!

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: I cut yer head off, you don't move.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: She clean.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (not hearing) She touched radidio. Fuck it up.

dialogues.speaker: MA MA
dialogues.text: (insisting) She clean, Jupe, no more bleed. Past midnight . RUBY PAINFULLY GETS UP, SHAKING.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: True, Pa Pa.

dialogues.speaker: MOSS.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Clean.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: Good thing.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (quietly) 'S Pluto n' Mars...

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (curtly) I got a nose.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: Wake up 'Ranus, Sattern 'n Neptune.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: Hey, girl. Wake up 'Ranus, Sattern, 'n Neptune. 'S time t' start th' fires.

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: (appreciatively) Somethin' smells gooood!

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE IT'S BIG BOB. HE'S NAKED, AND HE'S BEEN GUTTED.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: Pa Pa bring home the bacon.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You and that thing ought to get married.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey. Bobby. It's alright

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (coldly) You say that a lot. You find Shanti? DOUG MOVES THE GUN TO ONE SIDE AND GOES INTO THE TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: CLIMBS TO THE UPPER BUNK TO CHECK ON ETHEL.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Such a mess.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Shh, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Such a small space, a trailer... When it's messy it's so messy. Daddy come home?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Not yet, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Where're the kids -- they in bed yet?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Brenda's right below. Bobby's over in the kitchen. CUT TO BOBBY STARING BACK AT THE TWO, THEN AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Drinking Coke, I bet. Lynne asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can I get you anything.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Another blanket, if you can find one please.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: OF THESE WE CLEARLY SEE FIRE.
BOBBY
dialogues.text: They got most of our food, our C/B, extra cartridges, compass, knives, the hatchet... They cleaned us out.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENTION.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (continuing) They've killed two of us, maybe three, plus our two dogs, run us into the ditch - - they took your kid, for gosh sakes --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (turning to him) If you've something to say, why don't you say it?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't understand what you're waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Daylight.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I think you're afraid.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right, I'm afraid. So are you, schmuck!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of a bunch of... whatever they are.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: My ass. You're scared shitless. You haven't had that canon out of your hand since I got back this afternoon -- what do you expect me to do, go out and find Shanti by radar?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You could try.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Why don't you try to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'm not sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: IRRITATED BY DOUG'S APPARENT CALM.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who were they, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: They looked like some sort of motorcycle gang, the glimpse I got. Hell's Angels maybe.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: No motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Maybe Indians. Or escaped convicts. Or mental patients, or part of a Hippy killer clan, or mutants -- this is a test range, you know. They could be some sort of mutants. DOUG SEEMS LOST IN THOUGHT, AND RESPONDS TO NONE OF THIS.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bobby -- take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: C/B, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Neptune, you get Ruby t'night? haw! (static answer)

dialogues.speaker: ARMY MARKINGS. HE LOOKS AROUND.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Beast?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to "The Beast") You bring this? THE BEAST BARKS PROUDLY. DOUG TURNS TO BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Well, by God, we may not know who they are, but now we can know what they're saying to each other -- and I've got a feeling "The Beast" can take me to Shanti.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: You goin' soft.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Ain't.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: Y'are.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (sullenly) Go away.

dialogues.speaker: THING IS SET AND MADE SECURE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't believe this... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: They must have come back and taken him in the night.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why would they want his body? This is crazy!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Recognize the key?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (ignoring) Do you think we might have gotten ourselves into the middle of some kind of Army maneuvers? I mean, maybe they're some kind of Special Forces gone nuts maybe they don't realize who we are.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (sardonically) Oh? Who are we?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (with frightened logic) Americans. Civilians, for gosh sakes! They aren't supposed to go around burning and raping and kidnapping us, just because we try to sneak into California without a pass!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG GOES TO HER.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) Give us some help, would you?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Ready, old boy?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I'm going after Shanti. The Beast'll get me there, after that I'll send him back.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Follow that clown? He'll lead you down every gopher hole in the state before he'll take you to Shanti. And what about me? You're leaving me with a dying woman, a freaked out kid sister -- what if they come back? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: If they come back you'll have your hands full, no sense kidding ourselves. But you should have plenty of warning. The way they've been talking on the C/B through the night, it's clear they don't know we have one of their units. I've set our C/B to the same channel, 38. Every half hour or so you should call for help on the military channels -- the ones they're not using.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What makes you think there's anybody except these guys around?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Look, there's no way the people who hit us are Army, yet they have Army equipment. And it's battery operated, so they can't have had it too long.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So you're saying they stole it or something.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Or found it, or something. I'll stay in touch with you every fifteen minutes on the quarter hour. The rest of the time I'll be monitoring their channel. If I find out anything you should know, I'll pass it right along. How many rounds do you have?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nine. Six in the gun, three I found on the floor. I think they've got Dad's gun, and the extra ammunition. Plus most of the useful tools, almost all the food - - I think we have some bullion cubes, a can of shark fin soup hat Lynne bought in Denver. Even they wouldn't eat that

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE HANDS.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: If they come for the trailer, I'd suggest you head up into the rocks; you're sitting ducks in this damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And what if I contact the Army or Air Force of whoever the heck it is owns this corner of hell?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Tell them to get us the hell out of here, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant. I mean how do I tell them where to find us? DOUG STOPS AND SCRATCHES HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Burn a tire.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (half joking) Set the spare tire on fire. It'll make a lot of black smoke. They should be able to see it from a plane or copter. And tell them about the blue line on the map.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The map ain't the territory.

dialogues.speaker: AWAY, WATCHING HIM.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I thought you were injured, or something.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Where are Doug and the Beast going?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (heading to car) Doug thinks he can just go find those two guys and get them to give Shanti back.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (following Bobby. ) There's more than two. I heard all those voices on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Thought you were faking all that 'being in shock' stuff.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (growing hotter) You really are a disgusting human being. HE REFUSED TO LOOK AT HER, AND REFUSES TO RELENT.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't talk, if I were you. Mother's waiting, incidentally.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (livid) What do you think, I enjoyed it or something? (grabbing him) You think when it really got down to it I... (mockingly) found my pain turning to pleasure? You creep, you rotten son-of-a-bitch shit, you'd like it better if he'd killed me, too? Huh!? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (screaming) Why didn't he!!? (then, with regained control) Why didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: TO MAKE ROOM FOR THE NEXT.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Hey, Home 40, I'm cumin' in.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Who that?

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Neptune. Pa Pa?

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Yeah, this's Pa Pa. You s'posed t'be on lookout. I kick your ass if I see you here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Pa Pa, Merc'ry's dead. I'm bringin' him in.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (on C/B, disbelieving) What you say? I couldn't hear you straight. Sounded like...

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) I say Merc'ry's dead. When I got to the look cut post he was gone. I found him at bottom of th' cliff. He got pushed.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Who pushed him?

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) A dog. A big dog. There's tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shake.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: To hell with Merc'ry. Get back on guard. An' call me the second you see anything funny.

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) I ain't got no radidio, Pa Pa. I'm callin' from the inner picket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: Merc'ry's radidio broke?

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Couldn't find it no where... PA PA LOOKS EVEN MORE UNEASY. IT'S CLEAR HE'S NO DUMMY.

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: I'm comin' out. Stay there, an' don't transmit no more unless it's bandits, you 10-four that, Neptune?

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Eighty-eights and ten, Roger an' out. PA PA SLAMS THE HEADSET ONTO THE RECEIVER.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Well, Beast, the fan is about to hit the shit.

dialogues.speaker: BONE WHEN PA PA YANKS HIM RIGHT UP INTO THE AIR.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (quietly) Bobby...? Bobby, you read me?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (B/G)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday, Mayday, this is a breaker one- niner for KUY-9532 -- does anybody read this transmission? We need military or police aid -- Mayday, Mayday.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Brenda, will you keep still?

dialogues.speaker: CAN GET HER HANDS ON AT BOBBY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What're you trying to do, anyway, creep. Give Mom a heart attack?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. HE MOVES TOWARDS THE BED.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Bobby? Come in, dammit.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Bobby, do you read me -- they're coming your way, boy -- put your ears on!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hello, Police, Army -- this is KUY-9532 calling Mayday, Mayday, we have been attacked by, well, damn, we've been attacked and need help. HE RELEASES THE TALK BUTTON AND LISTENS FOR ANY RESPONSE.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE BLARES INTO THE ROOM, LOUD AND CLEAR.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello, KUY -- we have you loud and clear. This is Sgt. Alcort, U.S. Army intelligence. Please state your position and status of casualties. Over

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Thank God! Hello, listen, they've killed two -- three of us, kidnapped a baby -- we're in desperate need of protection -- uh, but I don't really know where we are. We were on Route 93, about a day past Corn Creek, but we got lost -- I think we're somewhere on one of your bomb ranges... I guess. THERE'S A MOMENT'S PAUSE. ANOTHER MOMENT. THEN.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE
dialogues.text: The Ellis Range?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, I guess so. We really don't know...

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE
dialogues.text: Hold on. THE AIR GOES TO STATIC, THEN DEAD. BOBBY LOOKS AT BRENDA. BRENDA LOOKS AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Somehow, he didn't sound too happy when he heard where we were. BEFORE BOBBY CAN RESPOND, THE MILITARY VOICE COMES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE
dialogues.text: We are checking with Staff as to procedure. We recommend you make some sort of signal, meanwhile; do you have that capability?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sure! We'll burn a tire -- make smoke, okay!? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE
dialogues.text: Very good. We will put search aircraft into the air and be back to too. Stay on this channel.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Right! Ten four! BOBBY PUTS DOWN THE MIC, TURNS TO BRENDA.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (cont'd) Don't touch it! HE RACES OUT OF THE TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (replay: 0.S.) I'll stay in touch with you every fifteen minutes on the quarter hour. If I find out anything you should know, I'll pass it right along.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Bobby, hello Bobby -- do you read me, over? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Doug! It's me, Brenda! Doug, the Army, we've got a hold of the Army!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (on C/B) What? Are they there!?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: N-no, they don't know where to find us -- but they've told us to make a signal -- Bobby's out setting a tire on fire, like you told him.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (on C/B) Listen, Brenda, they're coming.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: They Army?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (on C/B) No. The savages. The ones who've taken us on.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (instantly terrified.) H-how many?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (on C/B) A lot. Nine or ten. You'll have to get out of there and hide -- you've got time - - can Mom travel?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Do you want me to come back?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: No. You get Shanti. We'll take care of these turkeys.

dialogues.speaker: US AS SOMEONE WHO CAN HANDLE THOSE TURKEYS. MAYBE.
DOUG
dialogues.text: Okay, killer, go get that bastard!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How long did he say it'd be before they got here?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Ten or fifteen minutes, he guesses. He's sending "the Beast" back...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Big deal. A lot of good that clown'll do us -- hey, where you going?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY LOOKS AFTER HER AS IF SHE'S GONE CRAZY.
SAVAGE
dialogues.text: That for Pa Pa. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: (wheeling) I Pa Pa, now.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (C/B)
dialogues.text: Doug -- the Army says they see my signal - - they're on their way -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA, (C/B)
dialogues.text: (interrupting B/G) That's the wrong channel -- get off it

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (C/B)
dialogues.text: Wha -- oh (snap)

dialogues.speaker: PA PA
dialogues.text: We get them first.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: (under breath) Fuckin' devil dog.

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO
dialogues.text: (enraged) You sonuvabitch! You piece of shit! I killed you buddy, I kill you! I eat your heart, piss dog! Puke eater! I strangle you with you own guts!

dialogues.speaker: PLUTO HAD FALLEN. THERE'S A SMALL PUDDLE OF BLOOD.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: It's too awful. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's the only way. Com'on.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stay here until you see them. I'll fix the trailer.  112 113 114 84.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Doug, do you read me? Do you READ ME!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hello, Army. Where the hell are you guys? SURPRISINGLY, BOBBY IS INSTANTLY ANSWERED.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY OFFICER
dialogues.text: We're on our way, son! Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (desperate) Well how long, for God's sakes!

dialogues.speaker: ARMY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Just a little while.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE WOMAN, WHO IS PERHAPS A HUNDRED FEET AWAY.
ARMY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hello KUY-9532. We are in your sector. We are awaiting final instructions.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What kind of final orders -- listen these bastards are coming for us!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hello, Zeus, what are our orders?

dialogues.speaker: H.Q., (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Syncpak central computer says Red Light. No interference allowed. Do you read that? No interference.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Jesus. Roger, H.Q. Do we get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: H.Q., (RADIO)
dialogues.text: You are to remain and observe for full scenario report. THE OFFICER SHRUGS.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Roger. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: WITHIN MOMENTS HE IS SURROUNDED BY MEN WITH KNIVES.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Start the bastard.

dialogues.speaker: LITERAL HEAVE HO.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hold your breath and don't breathe! THEY GO IN.

dialogues.speaker: AND SEES HER OUT.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NOTE
dialogues.text: "Hold your ears, Turkey."

dialogues.speaker: HOBBLES OVER IN RAGE, YOWLING IN ANGER AND PAIN.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: She saved Shanti. She's one of us. And we're one of her. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Okay.
